description: SIP is an open-source program developed by Riverbank Computing. Developers can use SIP to call C and C++ functions from Python programs, translating them into Python code. To do so, developers must install SIP, create a SIP file that defines the C or C++ library they want to access, and use the SIP build system to include the SIP file and associated library in a Python program.

Typically, each SIP file looks very similar to a C or C++ library's header file. However, the SIP file includes a reference to the library's header file, and it may omit some of the library's functions and add additional functions. For example, if a function does not make sense to use in Python, the SIP file may not include that function.
